Personally - NAY.
 
 I know lots of people that have them, and all are great people, so I can't really explain it logically, it's just my taste. I don't care for them.

I know many people with them and some are really trash.
 
 I kinda like them just the same but only when tastefully executed.
Haulingboat

Agreed. Many are distasteful and poorly planned. I myself have several and will soon be recieving many more. No naked ladies or pot leaves. Nothing satanic and no old girl friends. I find it very interesting how differently some people approach me with them out as appossed to when they are covered. Lot's of predetermined attitudew towards tattoos.
Big Orn

I used to want one...or two, years ago, because my father had a couple.
 But now, I'm glad I didn't. But, to each his own, you know.
 
 I do have a couple of interesting scars. One, on my shoulder that looks like an embedded arrowhead. The other right between my eyes from chickenpox that gets ugly when I'm mad...sort of that CTFuzzy look. emoticon_frazzled :p
Haulingboat
What ever happened to Fuzzy? He disappeared long before the Pig Pen dibocle.
jim's trucking

Tattoos and piercings are just ways to be different. Dennis Rodman was on Leno's the other night displaying his. He's gone from outlandish hair dyes to expansive tattoos and body "jewelery". What a freakish thing he's turned himself into...had some compulsion to keep flipping a "C" shaped lip piercing back and forth over his lower lip.
 
 Regardless of how good he is at basketball, he's a freak with all that body altering.
 
 JMHO, but I believe you should be satisfied with the body you got naturally. If your hair turns white, so what? If it falls out, why try to cover your pate with long hairs originating from your neck? Play the hand you were dealt.
Anastasia

I am heavily tattooed and work in a corporate environment...and often judged before one gets to know me... in the end all is well, I prove to be something other than idiot or a drug addict :)
 I also notice when I am shopping or traveling I am watched a little more carefully than others..
 I enjoy my tattoos, I will keep getting them in fact just this Sunday added to my collection.. Mine are mostly polynesian art which I am VERY fond of.
 I was a tattooist for years and yes there are a lot of people that are wearing ink that give us "Normal" folk a bad name..
 Cute saying...
 The only difference between tattooed and non tattooed people is
 Tattooed people dont care if your tattooed or not. :)

 Well said. I concur with everything you just stated.
 I, being in sales, am forced to deal with all types of people. From the very old and conservative to the young and carefree. I'm constantly suprised by the change in attitude I encounter from the beginning of the transaction to the end of the transaction. Often it take a while to convince people that I am not a blundering tattooed idiot. Once we develop a relationship and they take delivery of their new boat I often get invited on fishing or dive trips and move on to become friends with many of my customers.
 
 It's amazing what difference a tattoo makes.
sglaine

Maybe you should look beyond Walmart to see a decent tattoo.....

 Yea but I havent seen any thing at Wal-Mart or about Wal-Mart. Yhe point I was getting at here is that tattoos I dont care for they are not for me or is Wal-Mart. Maybe Wal-Mart can sell them too and put a small biz out of biz because thats what they do best. emoticon_xagree

faeden

To be tattooed or not to be tattooed is my question. Back up your answers with logic please.

 
 I'm definitely not a tattoo fan and I'm really opposed to women getting them.
 I don't like anything that permanently disfigures the body. I'm also no fan of multiple piercings. Besides looking silly, they can be a safety hazard.

Lady Of Bohemia

I would get a small tattoo, except I saw what my grandfather looked like with wrinkled tats that belonged on a man 50 years younger.
 
 
 This is much like my own thinking. As far as I am concerned, everyone can tattoo themselves as much as they like. I am all for freedom of choice in this area, but when one grows old and wrinkled, the tattoo looks very ugly.
 
 Some may argue that wrinkled skin also looks ugly, but that is nature. Tattooed, wrinkled skin is a different matter.
 
 For myself, I once thought of having a tiny one in a place that was discreet, but asked myself why. Why do this to myself when I dislike the appearance on tattoos on others.? That would make me a person with double standards, and I cannot do that.
 
 But would I discriminate against anyone with tattoos? No. Does discrimination exist against people with tattoos? Yes.
 
 ~Anastasia
sglaine

This is much like my own thinking. As far as I am concerned, everyone can tattoo themselves as much as they like. I am all for freedom of choice in this area, but when one grows old and wrinkled, the tattoo looks very ugly.
 
 Some may argue that wrinkled skin also looks ugly, but that is nature. Tattooed, wrinkled skin is a different matter.

 But would I discriminate against anyone with tattoos? No. Does discrimination exist against people with tattoos? Yes.

 How are people discriminated with tattoos please tell me madam?
Anastasia

How are people discriminated with tattoos please tell me madam?

 That is very easy
 Lets see where to start
 When I go grocery shopping (same store 10 years) I am always followed...
 Airports.. Sinjin and I were in New Zealand.. and upon arrival we were separated and put into rooms and completly searched.
 People tend to judge you a lot faster if your tattooed, I find that I have to work just a bit harder to get my point across because we all know that tattooed people have exchanged ink for brains... please give me a break..
 No matter where I go, I have to assume I am being followed by security because apparently I am someone will make trouble.
 There are many examples....

 My Tats are easily covered by long sleeves. It find amazing the different first impression made when wearing sleeves as apposses to showing tattoos. Equally amazing are the reactions to my tats by a person that has known me for a while without knowing I had them. With certain folks it is easier to develop a relationship before revelling my tattoos. We can skip the whole prejudgement first impression stage.
 
 I am by no way ashamed by my tats. I do however understand that there are times to display them and times to cover them.
Anastasia

My Tats are easily covered by long sleeves. It find amazing the different first impression made when wearing sleeves as apposses to showing tattoos. Equally amazing are the reactions to my tats by a person that has known me for a while without knowing I had them. With certain folks it is easier to develop a relationship before revelling my tattoos. We can skip the whole prejudgement first impression stage.
 
 I am by no way ashamed by my tats. I do however understand that there are times to display them and times to cover them.

 I agree, I too cover them when needed.
 I love my tattoos and have no regrets. I also enoy when people change their views after getting to know me. I knew a women long before I had tattoos and she was around during my "transformation" and she told me one day that I had changed her mind about tattoos, before she had judged people with them, but after seeing someone "normal" like me get them and remain "normal" made her think that just maybe other people are the same :)
 I thought that was a great compliment!
